severity_system.description: French profanity severity assessment with cultural and regional considerations
severity_system.methodology: Based on French sociolinguistic research across francophone regions
severity_system.scale: 1-4 scale where 1 is mild and 4 is extremely offensive

1.name: Léger
1.description: Mild profanity, generally acceptable in informal settings
characteristics: May be filtered in professional settings
Can be diminished with tone and context

regional_notes.france: Higher tolerance for mild sexual references
regional_notes.belgium: Similar to France but slightly more conservative

regional_notes.belgium: Similar patterns to France with regional variations

3.name: Fort

characteristics: Can cause offense regardless of intent

4.name: Sévère
characteristics: Can have legal consequences in France

regional_notes.social_impact: Can cause lasting harm to individuals and communities

relationship.family: Severity often reduced in family context, except hate speech

relationship.professional: Even mild terms inappropriate in formal settings

intent.targeted: Increases severity when directed at person

tone.affectionate: Can change meaning (mon connard for close friend)
tone.angry: Escalates severity regardless of word choice
tone.emphatic: Increases intensity without necessarily increasing offense
